CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4 The most widely used approach for obtaining low - band gap structures is to utilize internal charge transfer ( ICT ) from an electron - donating to an electron - accepting moiety.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Internal Charge Transfer (ICT) |
| Electron-Donating Moiety |
| Electron-Accepting Moiety |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid "Material Name" entities:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Internal Charge Transfer (ICT) |
| Electron-Accepting Moiety |

The other entities in the paragraph, such as "electron-donating moiety," do not clearly refer to material names and have been excluded from the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4 The most widely used approach for obtaining low - band gap structures is to utilize internal charge transfer ( ICT ) from an electron - donating to an electron - accepting moiety.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| internal charge transfer (ICT) |
| electron-donating moiety |
| electron-accepting moiety |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid entities that refer to material properties in the given paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| low - band gap structures |
| electron-donating moiety |
| electron-accepting moiety |

Note that "internal charge transfer (ICT)" is not a material property, but rather a process or mechanism that can be used to modify material properties. Therefore, it has been removed from the list.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4 The most widely used approach for obtaining low - band gap structures is to utilize internal charge transfer ( ICT ) from an electron - donating to an electron - accepting moiety.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| low |
| band gap |
| internal charge transfer (ICT) |
| electron-donating |
| electron-accepting |

The entities in the paragraph that can be identified as "Property Value" are:

* low (referring to the band gap)
* band gap (referring to the property of the structure)
* internal charge transfer (ICT) (referring to the mechanism used to obtain low-band gap structures)
* electron-donating (referring to the property of a moiety that donates electrons)
* electron-accepting (referring to the property of a moiety that accepts electrons)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Value of material property":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| low |
| band gap |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and have been removed from the table:

* internal charge transfer (ICT) (mechanism used to obtain low-band gap structures)
* electron-donating (property of a moiety that donates electrons)
* electron-accepting (property of a moiety that accepts electrons)
